verses.roman:
taṁ vilokyācyuto dūrāt
priyā-paryaṅkam āsthitaḥ
sahasotthāya cābhyetya
dorbhyāṁ paryagrahīn mudā

synonyms: tam—him; vilokya—seeing; acyutaḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa; dūrāt—at a distance; priyā—of His beloved consort; paryaṅkam—on the bed; āsthitaḥ—seated; sahasā—immediately; utthāya—rising; ca—and; abhyetya—coming forward; dorbhyām—in His arms; paryagrahīt—embraced; mudā—with pleasure.
translation: At that time Lord Acyuta was seated on His consort's bed. Spotting the brāhmaṇa at some distance, the Lord immediately stood up, went forward to meet him and with great pleasure embraced him.
